intro: Calyctenium pectinellum, commonly known as the pectinellum goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it often forms dense colonies in disturbed areas. Calyctenium pectinellum is adapted to arid environments and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
